channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The New Gods of Weather Can Make Rain on Demand—or So They Want You to Believe
item.description: In a gold-trimmed command center on the outskirts of Abu Dhabi, scientists are seeking to wring moisture from desert skies. But will all their extravagant cloud-seeding tech—planes that sprinkle nanomaterials, lasers that scramble the atmosphere—really work at scale?

item.title: Packing travel insurance products into an app helped FAYE to a $31M Series B
item.description:
We’ve been covering US-based Insurtech startup FAYE way back since 2022 with its Seed round, and the Series A round in 2023, and it seems they continue to be on a roll, today announcing a $31 million in Series B funding. What is keeping this online insurance company on the rise?  Well, it would appear […]

item.title: How a Secret BJP War Room Mobilized Female Voters to Win the Indian Elections
item.description: A sophisticated effort used technology to identify women who could bring other women out to vote—and offered a glimpse of the future of campaigning in India.

item.title: Sennder buys CH Robinson’s European business
item.description:
Sennder is acquiring the European ground transportation assets of logistics giant C.H. Robinson.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Lime’s New Rideshare Ebikes Are More Approachable—Throttle and All
item.description: The LimeGlider and LimeBike, currently in pilot programs, have smaller frames and wheels and are equipped with throttles.

item.title: Egypt’s Cartona raises $8.1M even as investors pull back from B2B e-commerce in Africa
item.description:
When Egyptian B2B e-commerce platform Cartona last raised money in 2022, global and local investors were eager to invest in African startups solving the supply chain and operational challenges for retailers and suppliers in the fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) industry. Two years on, investors aren’t as enthused anymore as the business models of such startups, […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Instagram Will Let You Make Custom AI Chatbots—Even Ones Based on Yourself
item.description: Meta’s AI Studio will let users build virtual characters, with a few limitations.

item.title: Qoo10’s CEO pledges personal assets worth $58M to compensate Korean merchants affected by its liquidity crisis
item.description:
During an emergency hearing held by the South Korean government, Young-bae Ku, Qoo10's founder said he would secure the amount over the next 30 days.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Bird Flu Threat Keeps Growing
item.description: Human cases keep ticking up, are very likely to be underreported, and offer the virus the opportunity to learn how to spread from person to person.

item.title: Qualcomm’s new Snapdragon chip aims to bring 5G to sub-$100 devices
item.description:
Qualcomm has launched the Snapdragon 4s Gen 2 chip to 5G smartphones in the sub-$100 price segment in India and other emerging markets.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.
